abstract: Ben Brantley Critic's Notebook refutes Pres-elect Donald Trump's assertion that theater should be 'safe and special place' after Vice Pres-elect Mike Pence was confronted from stage at performance of Broadway musical Hamilton; notes complex and challenging role theater has always played in society and predicts Trump, like presidents before him, will be subject of much theatrical commentary and satire to come.

headline.print_headline: On the Stage, Aim for Special, but Not for Safe
headline.main: ‘Hamilton’ Duel: Addressing the President-Elect on His Own Blunt Terms

snippet: In delivering his plea to Mike Pence after the show, the Broadway actor Brandon Victor Dixon was also speaking to Donald J. Trump, meeting directness with directness....
lead_paragraph: In delivering his plea to Mike Pence after the show, the Broadway actor Brandon Victor Dixon was also speaking to Donald J. Trump, meeting directness with directness.
